block.p: Jane Xin Huang, a daughter of YuQuing and ZhaoJun Huang of Flushing, Queens, is to be married today to Alexander Michael Sharf, a son of Jane Sharf and Dr. Richard Sharf of Newark, Del. The Rev. Susan Marlan, an interfaith minister, will officiate at the Sheraton La Guardia East in Flushing.

The couple work in Harrisburg, Pa., for Tyco International, the industrial conglomerate, the bride as a senior business analyst and the bridegroom as a senior computer and telecommunications engineer.

Jane Xin Huang, a daughter of YuQuing and ZhaoJun Huang of Flushing, Queens, is to be married today to Alexander Michael Sharf, a son of Jane Sharf and Dr. Richard Sharf of Newark, Del. The Rev. Susan Marlan, an interfaith minister, will officiate at the Sheraton La Guardia East in Flushing.

The couple work in Harrisburg, Pa., for Tyco International, the industrial conglomerate, the bride as a senior business analyst and the bridegroom as a senior computer and telecommunications engineer.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She received bachelor's and master's degrees in industrial engineering from the State University at Buffalo. Her parents are clerks at the Chinese-American Methodist Center, a day-care and after-school center in Manhattan.

Mr. Sharf, 27, received a bachelor's degree in electrical and computer engineering from Carnegie Mellon University. His parents work at the University of Delaware, where Mrs. Sharf is a writing instructor and Dr. Sharf is a psychologist in the Center for Counseling and Student Development.
